data.title: All 44 Elke Sommer Movies (in Order)
data.text:
Get ready to dive into the captivating world of Elke Sommer, the renowned actress who has left her mark on the silver screen. In this engaging movie roundup, we delve into her diverse and memorable cinema roles. From romantic comedies to suspenseful thrillers, explore the full range of Elke Sommer‚Äôs dynamic and inspiring on-screen presence. Discover her impact on the film industry and uncover the many reasons why her movies have left an indelible mark on audiences worldwide.

As an Amazon‚Ñ¢ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. L‚Äôamico del giaguaro (1959)

L‚Äôamico del giaguaro‚Äù is a witty Italian comedy film set in the 1950s, released in 1959. The movie follows the hilarious antics of Augusto, a grown man from an orphanage, who turns to a life of crime. Frustrated with his inability to sustain a job, Augusto assembles a gang of misfits and embarks on a life of larceny, targeting the rich and well-off.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Uomini e nobiluomini (1959)

Experience an enchanting tale of love, class, and family in ‚ÄúUomini e nobiluomini‚Äù (1959). Orphaned since the age of two, Giovanna, now growing, finds solace and support in her loving uncle, Nicola Peccoli. However, her affection for her humble sweetheart, Mario, a working-class man, faces disapproval from her uncle due to social differences.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. Lampenfieber (1960)

Lampenfieber, ‚Äù a 1960 cinematic masterpiece from West Germany, directed by Kurt Hoffmann and written by Heinz Pauck and Hans Schweikart, presents a poignant drama filled with intrigue and emotion. Set in an episodic theater setting, this gripping film follows the journey of different characters as they navigate through various aspects of life.

4. Love, the Italian Way (1960)

Embark on a luxurious Mediterranean adventure in the 1960 romantic comedy, ‚ÄúLove, the Italian Way. ‚Äù Director Giorgio Bianchi takes viewers on a journey packed with romance, comedy, and stunning Italian landscapes. As a group of passengers aboard a lavish cruise liner, they soon find themselves involved in a whirlwind of charming encounters and heartfelt connections.

5. Howlers of the Dock (1960)

Howlers of the Dock, ‚Äù also known as ‚ÄúUrlatori alla sbarra, ‚Äù is a 1960 Italian musical comedy film that takes viewers on a lively journey following a group of friends, teddy boys, and rock and roll chicks. As these eclectic individuals bring their infectious energy and unconventional habits to Rome, they inspire some citizens to jive and others to complain.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. Und sowas nennt sich Leben (1961)

Und sowas nennt sich Leben‚Äù (1961), a poignant German drama directed by G√©za von Radv√°nyi, delves into the complexities of life and love. Set in a post-World War II era, the film tells the story of a young woman, played by Elke Sommer, who falls in love with a man who has returned home from war, portrayed by Michael Hinz. The movie explores themes of loss, healing, and the human spirit‚Äôs resilience.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. Bah√≠a de Palma (1962)

Bah√≠a de Palma‚Äù is a charming 1962 Spaniard film that follows the life of Mario Ferr√°n, a talented pianist who has lost his dream of becoming a concert pianist due to a family tragedy. His ultimate goal is to regain his passion and perform as the best Chopin player. Upon arrival in Palma de Mallorca, he is greeted by Olga Vidal, a captivating woman who becomes his muse, reigniting his love for music and bringing him closer to his dream.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. Who Stole the Body? (1963)

Who Stole the Body? ‚Äù is a comical 1963 French film that tells the story of √âdouard and F√©lix, two struggling real estate agents. Their boss threatens to fire them and they are given one last chance to save their jobs by selling a secluded house to an elderly English woman. However, upon entering the house, they find a decomposing corpse inside.

9. The Prize (1963)

The Prize (1963) follows the lives of Nobel Prize winners who arrive in Stockholm to receive their awards. As the international gathering unfolds, their lives are rocked and shaken in unexpected ways. Directed by Mark Robson and starring an ensemble of brilliant actors, this gripping crime, drama, and mystery film takes the audience on a thrilling journey through espionage, danger, and secrets.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. The Victors (1963)

The Victors, a gripping war film set during World War II, tells the intelligent and sprawling saga of a squad of American soldiers as they traverse Europe. This immersive journey showcases the courage and determination of these unsung heroes and the sacrifices they made. Starring a strong cast, including Albert Finney and George Hamilton, this high-quality film captures the essence of war and its profound impact on those involved.

11. Amongst Vultures (1964)

Amongst Vultures, ‚Äù or ‚ÄúUnter Geiern‚Äù in German, is a 1964 Western adventure film directed by Alfred Vohrer and starring Pierre Brice, G√∂tz George, and Elke Sommer. Set in the tumultuous Arizona and Apache territories, the story centers around the infamous outlaw gang posing as Indians, wreaking havoc among settlers. However, the peace-loving Winnetou and his trusty sidekick, Old Surehand, set out on a mission to expose these impostors and bridge the gap between settlers and the Native American community.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. A Shot in the Dark (1964)

A Shot in the Dark‚Äù is a delightful 1964 comedy-mystery film directed by Blake Edwards and written by Blake Edwards, William Peter Blatty, and Harry Kurnitz. The film stars Peter Sellers as Inspector Jacques Clouseau, who is tasked with solving a murder case. Along the way, he falls in love with the main suspect and works tirelessly to clear her name.

13. Hotel der toten G√§ste (1965)

Hotel der toten G√§ste, ‚Äù also known as ‚ÄúMurder in Room 101‚Äù (1965), takes viewers on a suspenseful journey through a mysterious hotel in London. The film follows detective Janos Kovacs, who journeys from San Remo to sell crucial information to crime reporter Barney Blair. However, before Barney arrives, an attack occurs, and Kovacs is stabbed.

14. The Art of Love (1965)

Experience the zany and heartwarming comedy, ‚ÄúThe Art of Love‚Äù, from 1965! Join a struggling artist as he fakes his own death to ensure his artwork reaches the fame and fortune it deserves. Along the way, he finds himself in a hilarious romantic triangle with a stunning blonde woman, while dealing with an energetic and charming buddy.

15. The Dolls (1965)

The Dolls‚Äù (1965) is an Italian anthology film that brings together four distinct stories of love, showcasing passion, heartbreak, and laughter in a unique blend of comedy and romance. Directed by the talented trio of Mauro Bolognini, Luigi Comencini, and Dino Risi, the film boasts a remarkable cast including Nino Manfredi, Virna Lisi, and Elke Sommer.

16. The Money Trap (1965)

The Money Trap‚Äù takes crime and drama to new heights, set to thrill audiences with intriguing twists and turns. When a safe carrying half a million dollars disappears from a doctor‚Äôs office, the assignment cops, Joe and Pete, decide to take matters into their own hands. With a clever plan, they resolve to find the stolen money and keep it themselves.

17. Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number! (1966)

Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number! is a delightful 1966 comedy film that will have you laughing from start to finish. Starring the legendary Bob Hope as a real estate agent, the film takes a playful turn when a seductive starlet flees Hollywood and accidentally stirs chaos in his life.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. The Oscar (1966)

The Oscar‚Äù is a 1966 drama film that delves into the world of Hollywood and the glamorous lifestyle of its stars. The story revolves around a self-centered actor who becomes even more full of himself after being nominated for the prestigious Academy Award for Best Actor.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. Mondo Hollywood: Hollywood Laid Bare! (1967)

Mondo Hollywood: Hollywood Laid Bare! ‚Äù is a riveting documentary that delves into the social, political, and cultural milieu of Los Angeles, with a particular focus on the glamorous world of Hollywood during the swinging ‚Äô60s. This intriguing film offers an insightful look at the society, attitudes, and lifestyle of the time, including the legendary ‚ÄúSummer of Love. ‚Äù

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. They Came to Rob Las Vegas (1968)

They Came to Rob Las Vegas, ‚Äù released in 1969, is a crime-thriller drama that revolves around a group of criminals and their heist plan. Set in the glamorous city of Las Vegas, the film follows a casino blackjack dealer, who, along with his girlfriend and a gang of thieves, devise an elaborate plan to hijack a $7 million armored car carrying the cash between Las Vegas and Los Angeles.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. The Wrecking Crew (1968)

The Wrecking Crew, ‚Äù set in 1968, throws the viewer into an action-packed adventure filled with espionage and comedy. When a billion-dollar gold bullion heist takes place aboard a hijacked train in Denmark, the prime suspect is none other than Count Massimo Contini. The U. S. Government steps in, sending their top agent, Matt Helm, played by Dean Martin, to conduct the investigation and recover the stolen gold.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. Probe (1972)

Probe‚Äù (1972), a sci-fi, thriller, and crime movie, follows the high-tech investigations company World Securities and its Agents, known as Probes, as they solve international cases. The storyline includes the retrieval of a stolen diamond collection during World War II. The film‚Äôs unique traits include the use of miniature cameras, implanted monitors, and psychotronic technology.

23. Baron Blood (1972)

Baron Blood, ‚Äù also known as ‚ÄúGli orrori del castello di Norimberga, ‚Äù is a spine-chilling 1972 horror film directed by Mario Bava. The movie follows the story of a young man who unknowingly revives the malevolent spirit of his murderous ancestor while visiting his castle in Austria. Fueled by an insatiable thirst for blood, the resurrected baron begins a terrifying hunt for new victims, ensnaring the unsuspecting townspeople in his sinister web.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

24. Die Reise nach Wien (1973)

Die Reise nach Wien‚Äù (1973) tells the story of two small-town German women who, during the final months of World War Two, unearth a stash of money hidden in an attic. With the war‚Äôs end imminent, they decide to use this unexpected windfall to embark on an extraordinary journey to Vienna.

25. It‚Äôs Not the Size That Counts (1974)

Get ready for a wild ride with the comedy ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Not the Size That Counts, ‚Äù released in 1976. This film, featuring a star-studded cast, centers around Percy, a man with the world‚Äôs first successful penis transplant.

26. Ten Little Indians (1974)

Ten Little Indians (1974) is a gripping crime, mystery, and thriller film directed by Peter Collinson. Inspired by the well-known Agatha Christie novel, the movie follows ten unsuspecting guests who receive an invitation to a luxurious hotel in the heart of the Iranian desert. Unbeknownst to them, a calculating murderer lurks amongst their midst, and they soon become prey to a sinister game of self-justice and survival.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. The House of Exorcism (1975)

In the haunting 1975 horror film, ‚ÄúThe House of Exorcism, ‚Äù a troubled priest embarks on a harrowing journey through the dark depths of spiritual warfare. The story follows a tourist who becomes possessed by the devil after witnessing supernatural events at a Spanish villa. Guided by his faith, the priest must perform an exorcism to free the soul of his tormented subject.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. The Swiss Conspiracy (1976)

In the 1976 thriller ‚ÄúThe Swiss Conspiracy, ‚Äù a former U. S. Justice Department official turns his sharp instincts to a new line of work as he becomes a security consultant for a prestigious Swiss bank in Zurich. However, trouble ensues when five of the bank‚Äôs most valuable clients are blackmailed. As the stakes rise, the new security consultant finds himself embroiled in a dangerous game of cat and mouse with the blackmailer. Will he be able to uncover their identity and save the bank‚Äôs clients or will the Swiss bank‚Äôs secrets remain locked away forever?

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. US Against the World (1977)

Immerse yourself in the nostalgic world of US Against the World, a highly-rated 1977 television special that showcases the wit and athleticism of stars from the US, UK, and beyond. This captivating 2-hour event pits ten teams of five men and three women against one another, all vying for the title of the best team in the competition.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. The Astral Factor (1978)

The Astral Factor‚Äù (1978) is a chilling sci-fi thriller that delves into the realm of the paranormal. After a convicted strangler discovers the art of astral projection, he gains an incredible ability to make himself invisible. As a spectral fiend, he orchestrates a horrifying plan to haunt and murder the five women who testified against him in court.

31. The Double McGuffin (1979)

In the small town of McGuffin, a group of school kids stumble upon a briefcase full of money in an abandoned home. They decide to take it to the police but return to find the money gone, replaced by a mysterious dead body.

32. The Fantastic Seven (1979)

Escape the high seas in ‚ÄúThe Fantastic Seven, ‚Äù a 1979 thriller starring Christopher Connelly as Stuntman Hill Singleton. When movie star Rebecca Wayne is kidnapped while filming on location, Hill Singleton is the only one who can save her. With the FBI‚Äôs hands tied due to international waters, Singleton must take matters into his own hands.

33. Exit Sunset Boulevard (1980)

Exit Sunset Boulevard, directed by Bastian Clev√© and released in 1980, delivers an entrancing cinematic experience as it unravels the enigmatic world of screenwriter R√ºdiger Kuhlbrodt. Clev√©‚Äôs unique vision transports audiences to a world dominated by the fascinating, yet somewhat enigmatic, figures of Hollywood.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. A Nightingale Sang in Berkeley Square (1980)

A Nightingale Sang in Berkeley Square‚Äù is a 1980 British comedy-crime film directed by Ralph Thomas. The movie stars Richard Jordan, Oliver Tobias, and David Niven as they navigate the underworld of London‚Äôs criminal world.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. Inside the Third Reich (1982)

Step into the chilling world of the Third Reich in the gripping 1982 film, ‚ÄúInside the Third Reich. ‚Äù This captivating biography, based on Albert Speer‚Äôs autobiography of the same name, follows the extraordinary life of Speer, played by the talented Rutger Hauer. Speer, a young architect, finds himself in close proximity to the infamous Adolf Hitler, portrayed compellingly by Sir Derek Jacobi. As Hitler‚Äôs confidant, Speer‚Äôs rise within the Nazi hierarchy takes him to unexpected heights.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

36. Women I Love: Beautiful But Funny (1982)

Women I Love: Beautiful But Funny‚Äù is a 1982 television special that takes viewers on a nostalgic journey with comedic legend Bob Hope. The movie showcases over 60 beautiful and funny women that Hope has had the pleasure of working with throughout his decades-long career in television and film. Featuring clips from various projects, this heartwarming comedy offers a rare glimpse into the personal and professional relationships that made Hope‚Äôs career so memorable.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Lily in Love (1984)

Lily in Love, ‚Äù a delightful 1984 comedy directed by K√°roly Makk, stars the remarkable Maggie Smith as Lily Wynn, an accomplished stage actress married to the self-centered Broadway star, Fitzroy Wynn, played by Christopher Plummer. Their passionate onstage and offstage dynamics keep the audience thoroughly entertained.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Der Stein des Todes (1987)

Der Stein des Todes, ‚Äù a 1987 German action film, follows the thrilling tale of Kuma Cunningham and Jane Lindstr√∂m, a couple in love unknowingly caught up in a deadly game of fate. Their lives take an unexpected turn when they stumble upon a mysterious, enchanted stone. Believing it to be bad luck, Kuma begs Jane to dispose of it, but fate has its own twisted agenda.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. Severed Ties (1992)

In a world where scientific experimentation knows no bounds, Dr. Crichton stands at the forefront of cutting-edge research. When a routine regeneration experiment goes terribly wrong, the result is not a new limb, but a sinister reptilian creature. Driven by greed and desperation, Dr. Crichton enlists the help of homeless crippled veterans, injecting them with the serum that gives birth to his monstrous creation. With his evil mother threatening to shut down his research, Dr. Crichton‚Äôs army of reptilian beings become the key to his survival and the continuation of his twisted endeavors.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Alles nur Tarnung (1996)

Alles nur Tarnung, ‚Äù a German comedy from 1996, delivers a witty and lighthearted tale of prison life. The film follows a motley crew of inmates, including the enigmatic Leo, played by Mario Adorf, and the daring J√ºrgen, portrayed by Ben Becker, as they try to maintain their sense of humor amidst the harsh realities of incarceration.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. The Hand Behind the Mouse: The Ub Iwerks Story (1999)

The Hand Behind the Mouse: The Ub Iwerks Story is an in-depth exploration of the life and work of the talented yet underappreciated animator Ub Iwerks. Primarily known for his significant contribution to the creation of Mickey Mouse, the documentary delves into the lesser-known aspects of Iwerks‚Äô life and career. From his early years and the inspiration behind his work to his close collaboration with Walt Disney and the impact of his creations on animation filmmaking, this engaging documentary offers a rare glimpse into the world of Hollywood animation.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. Dreams with Sharp Teeth (2008)

Step into the mind of a literary genius in ‚ÄúDreams with Sharp Teeth, ‚Äù a thought-provoking documentary that explores the remarkable world of speculative fiction writer Harlan Ellison. Directed and written by Erik Nelson, the film offers a captivating insight into the life and work of Ellison, a celebrated talent in the genres of science fiction and fantasy filmmaking.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

43. Saucy 70‚Äôs Volume 2 (2010)

Saucy 70‚Äôs Volume 2‚Äù is a nostalgic and provocative documentary that takes viewers on a wild ride back in time. This four and a half-hour film features a fascinating collection of 1970s content, showcasing the bold and daring spirit of the era. With a runtime of 4 hours and 56 minutes, this documentary is a must-see for those who love the 70s and its unique cultural influences.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

44. Video Nasties: Moral Panic, Censorship & Videotape (2010)

In the late 1970s and throughout the 1980s, a group of films known as ‚Äúvideo nasties‚Äù sent shockwaves through the United Kingdom, causing widespread panic and leading to strict censorship regulations. ‚ÄúVideo Nasties: Moral Panic, Censorship & Videotape‚Äù is a compelling documentary that explores the hysteria surrounding these movies and how they shaped the nation‚Äôs film industry. Directed by Jake West, this film delves into the social, political, and legal consequences of the moral panic that swept Britain, as well as the role that movies can play in shaping societal attitudes.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art
